answerText: karyotyping [or karyotype][10] This term denotes any deviation from possessing an exact multiple of the haploid number of chromosomes. This general phenomenon, examples of which include Turner syndrome and Down syndrome, is easily detected  by karyotyping.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2015 | UCSD + Michigan | 1 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: M-FISH and Rx-FISH are often used to "paint" the specimens in this technique. For 10 points each: [10] Name this technique, which produces a complete display of all 23 human chromosomes.
